  • lib/serie-2d.module
  • ModuleSerie2D

Namespace ModuleSerie2D

Presentation

A 2D serie can be displayed in a ModuleScatterPlot. It includes the definition of the x and y coordinates as well as styling properties.

Typical usage

The creation of a 2D serie requires:

  • some incoming data from which the x and y point coordinates will be created
  • some styling properties (color, labels, etc) through the module configuration.

ðŸ‘¾ The serie has a serieId property defined in the configuration. It is an important field to consider when multiple series will be displayed in a viewer, see scatter plot module documentation.

Extracting coordinates from incoming data

The conversion between the data part of the incoming message and the coordinates of the 2D serie is achieved using the configuration's coordinates property. It defines a function that take in argument the data part of the incoming message and return an object with x and y properties: the list of abscises and coordinates of the points.

For instance when the incoming data is a dataframe with at least 2 columns A and B:

return (data) => {
    return { 
        x: data.series.A,  // assume the column A exists in the dataframe
        y: data.series.B   // assume the column B exists in the dataframe
    }
}

Styling

Some styling properties are directly exposed through the module's configuration (e.g. mode), while others can be provided as a json data-structure using the extraOptions field of the configuration.

More details can be found here
